text: welcome to English grammar spot this
tutorial is about the future
tenses in this lesson I'm going to show
you how to form a future tense and when
to use a future
tense take a look at these sentences I
will help you carry those bags she's
going to work tomorrow she's flying to
London next week the bus leaves at 6:00
the prices are about to go up and by
this time tomorrow he will be lying on a
beach all of these sentences are in the
future tense but as you can see there's
quite some
variation the most commonly used future
tenses are shall and will plus the base
form of the verb to be going to plus the
base form of the verb the present
continuous the present simple to be
about to and the base form of the verb
and the future
continuous let's look at shall and will
plus the base form of the verb we use
this form for things decided on the spot
they are not fixed agreements and they
are not very likely to follow through we
need to pay extra attention to Shell
because we only use sh in questions with
I and we shall I help you with that and
shall we go for
swim we use will in all other situations
I will take the bus you will listen to
me we will will make dinner and they
will drop
by let's look at questions with will
again we use the base form of the verb
will he put up his tent will she
celebrate her birthday will you park
your bikes in the
shed let's look at negations with
will we use will and add not Contracting
it into W and the base form of the verb
now I've also included
shall shall plus not become shant and
the base form of the verb but this form
is very oldfashioned but I thought it
would be fun to put it in anyway Shan I
get sunburned it's quite vectorian you
won't cross the road it won't be easy we
won't make the beds and they won't need
a
passport now let's look take a look at
that other form to be plus going to plus
the verb we use this form for fixed
plans made for the future we need to
know when it's going to happen so we
need to have some kind of time
indication I'm going to help my brother
next week it is going to rain tomorrow
and we are going to cook dinner
tonight they are going to Mark the Tes
in an hour it's quite likely that these
plans will follow through let's look at
the
questions am I going to pass my exams
this afternoon is she going to visit her
aunt soon are they going to to run the
marathon next
week and let's have a look at the
negations I'm not going to learn it by
heart this evening he isn't going to buy
a new computer on Tuesday they aren't
going to watch the Telly this
night now sometimes we also use a
present continuous when talking about
the future we use the present continuous
for plans in the very near future and
again we need to know when they are
happening I'm working this after
afternoon he's calling her in the
morning and we are driving down the
street any minute
now sometimes we also use a present
simple for the future especially for
fixed schedules the lesson starts at
Half 8 the bus arrives at 10:00 the
train departs from platform
B another form to talk about the future
is to use to be about to plus the base
form of the verb
we use this form when you are are on the
verge of doing something you use this
form for something that can happen at
any minute from now the lesson is about
to begin the airplane is about to take
off and they are about to open the
department
store a final form is the future
continuous and this is quite a tricky
one we use the future continuous when
you tell someone about your future plans
something that you will be doing at a
specific time in the
future we use shall and will we use the
infinitive of the verb to be or the base
form of the verb to be we use the base
form of a regular verb and
ing for example by this time next here I
will be working at the head office and
no they can't help you tomorrow
they will be doing their homework I
thank you for your attention for regular
updates please subscribe to
youtube.com/englishgrammarspot
or go to ww. englishgrammar spot.com
